website_summaries.verdict: A comprehensive kit that has everything you need to test the water in your home swimming pool or spa.
pros: An accurate test kit with enough reagents to last you for an entire season
The kit can test free and total chlorine, bromine, pH, alkalinity, cyanuric acid, and calcium hardness
There is a reference chart in the lid of the case to remind you how to perform each test
cons: The kit is comprehensive and therefore requires a bit of knowledge to use effectively

customer_reviews.title: Gold standard pool chemical tests
customer_reviews.text: Let me get the first to tell you if you're still using strips it's time to let them go. Move onto a real test kit. The Taylor kits is really the only way to go. The instructions are clear -- the reagents agents do exactly as they say. For exact results-- the kind that the strip just won't deliver this is your jam. I started doing my own pool maintenance this year and I would be lost it wasn't for these kits - they're fantastic and buying replacement agents and reagents is breeze. No question if you want to be serious about your pool get yourself a set of Taylor testing stuff
customer_reviews.author: Edward O

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by the contractor that plastered my pool
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by the contractor that plastered my pool. I have been using this for a few weeks and it covers all the more important water quality tests you will need including pH, free chlorine, total chlorine,total alkalinity, calcium hardness, and cyanuric acid . It has many more tests it can perform, but the described tests are fundamental.
customer_reviews.author: Edgehaha

customer_reviews.title: If you work in a lab, buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I love pleasure!!! That’s why I use my hot tub as often as possible! The sales guy recommended this kit, so I bought it. Was not intending to attend college courses to use the dam thing. I use the quick testing strips, love that. Not saying that this test kit is not good, just saying not for me!!!
customer_reviews.author: JACKMAN

customer_reviews.title: Best Kit For Do-It-Yourself Pool Checking
customer_reviews.text: The best product available if you do your own testing. Easy to use. Make sure you watch expiration dates on each bottle. Replace as needed. I personally just buy a new kit every 2 years. Improve life of kit by keeping the kit in air conditioned space, with lid closed.
customer_reviews.author: TuckerBear

customer_reviews.title: Best manual ever.  They want you to understand.
customer_reviews.text: I am an analytical scientist who bought a house with a salt water pool and a well that supplies very hard water so I wanted to fully understand the chemistry. The small book that is included will help anyone gain a solid understanding of pool chemistry. I learned the pH of a human eye is 7.5. That is why you target a pool pH of 7.5. Testing more than pH and chlorine will save you money. Understanding the stabilizer will save a s@#t ton of chlorine. Understanding alkalinity helps fix pH. Understanding calcium will save your pumps and the walks of your pool. COULDN'T BE HAPPIER.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by many, many forums for personal pool care. I get pretty accurate results (yes I tested at home with this kit and at the pool store for 1 month/4 tests before writing this review). It's easy to use and helps me keep my SWG pool clean and under control.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Short

customer_reviews.title: I really like this now. I use it every day.
customer_reviews.text: Our pool is so difficult to keep perfect - especially in Florida in the Summer when the water gets really warm. But this has saved me so much money for pool service. Before the kids go in I make sure the ph and the chlorine is good. I double-check with a test strip once in a while and with the digital ph tester. One thing that could be added is a phosphor check. That usually is my main problem here, but I got that separately too.
customer_reviews.author: Martina Bourque

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: You get the same results and ease or difficult to read as a test strip. So ask yourself, why waste $60-$100 on this product when you get the same results with the same ease or difficult of reading as $10 bottle of test strips. But if you did purchase a set and you're not satisfied, don't expect to be able to return the product for a refund. What they neglect to put in their product description or anywhere on their product write up is that they don't accept returns/refunds. 1000% dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Rocco

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what We Need
customer_reviews.text: The test kit will be used for managing the chemistry of a large evaporative cooler in a greenhouse in a municipal garden. The tests are what we need; the kit itself is packaged so we can conveniently use it and store it. For old eyes, the instructions are a bit of a challenge to read. But, the test are so simple we will get through it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: sailing fool

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to check my pool when opening it this year. Checked all of the chemicals that I could with the kit. Wasn't sure the accuracy f the kit so took water sample to my pool testing center to check. Not one single reading was accurate. The alkalinity showed very low with the kit but the water test showed the alkalinity very high. Waist of money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Putman

customer_reviews.title: Helped me get my pool chemistry right
customer_reviews.text: This product lets you accurately get your pool chemistry right. Yes, it’s more work than the strips, but the strips can be very inaccurate. Directions are clear and easy to follow. They even give you a little booklet that explains water chemistry and has tables to tell you the amount of chemical to add for the correction.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Taylor is king!
customer_reviews.text: Can't do wrong with Taylor. Just bought a house with a pool and want to take care of the maintenance myself. I serviced piols about 20 years ago and the chemisty hasnt changed. Taylor was my go to then and now.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to tell which color it matches!!! Useless!
customer_reviews.text: When testing the chlorine, the water turned hot pink. According to the test, hot pink can either be 5ppm or 10ppm. One is safe to swim, the other is not. This test kit cost $70 and the two shades of hot pink are virtually indistinguishable!!! SUCH a ripoff. Oh, and they don't accept returns?? so irritated.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Mccabe

customer_reviews.title: Great instruction/informational manual included to teach you about water chemistry
customer_reviews.text: Great instruction/informational manual included to teach you about water chemistry. It's nice to be able to test more with this kit instead of the standard chlorine, ph, alkalinity test kits. I would buy again and will have to buy refills since these are the small droppers.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Just got a pool and this is a great kit. Can't compare to anything really since we've ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got a pool and this is a great kit. Can't compare to anything really since we've never had to do this before. This kit tests for pH, Alkalinity, calcium hardness, CYO and maybe acid challenge test?? I can't remember everything it tests for as I don't have it in front of me, but I know it tests for everything that they told us we needed in "Pool School".
customer_reviews.author: Kimboree

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: Beware this kit has the Taylor components as the K-2005 however the label is not Taylor. How can I trust the originality of the kit, the Seller has a picture of the Taylor Kit not Leslies Complete Poolcare DPD Test Kit
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Tagallie

customer_reviews.title: Matches the results from the automated tester @ Leslie's
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of having to drive to Leslie's Pool to see how my chemicals were, so I got this to test them on my own. I have compared my readings to the ones I get from Leslie's with the same water - and they match. Perfect! Now I just wish I could keep the Free Cl in my pool higher ;)
customer_reviews.author: J. Eberhard

customer_reviews.title: Save the trip to the pool store
customer_reviews.text: All test agents except 1 are good until 2022, the other one is good until 2021 which isnt a huge deal because they should be replaced every year anyways, at least that's what I'm told. The box is sturdy with a nice hinge and flip up handle and everything looks brand new, not like it was returned or anything.
customer_reviews.author: SeriousTree

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: The instruction book has much more information than what you may want but the tests are easy to conduct and a chart in the booklet gives you all the feedback you really need. Tests seem to be very accurate and compare well to what our local pool and spa company run for us.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Toll

customer_reviews.title: Works well to test chlorine, PH, and whatever else a hot tub needs.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to test hot tub water. Use the chart from the middle of the book, the rest results page and the lid to do all of the tests. I love that I don’t have to take water to the store to have it tested all the time.
customer_reviews.author: MaLove

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for accurate Pool readings. A must have.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have test kit. Dipsticks are great but not always accurate or precise. This kit will test everything you need for a pool or spa. It comes with a great instruction manual that can turn any layperson into a professional water tester.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremylpn

customer_reviews.title: Good buy can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Less expensive then my local retailers by a few dollars plus delivered to my door step. Exact same kit I have now. Great quality
customer_reviews.author: brad pascual

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional quality, but could use better color scale for chlorine measurement to assure accuracy
customer_reviews.text: This is a professional quality kit. Thankfully, you can easily get refills for the most commonly used reagents. I took one star off for the annoyingly hard to discriminate chorine/bromine color scale (the backlighting has to be perfect to match the color) . The pH scale is easy. They really ought to work harder on a more disinctive reagent chemistry to make the colors more obviously different
customer_reviews.author: LanceD

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and worth the extra work
customer_reviews.text: Ditch the test strips. I know they are quick and relatively idiot proof but hardly accurate. I love this kit and buy one every year or so for my pool. It’s really not that difficult just follow the directions on the lid for testing.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to discern the small differences in color for pH, but overall a very accurate kit. I had a colorQ kit before, and it was just too expensive for the reagants and wasn't nearly as accurate.
customer_reviews.author: B. Richards

customer_reviews.title: NOT RETURNABLE JUNK Inaccurate results
customer_reviews.text: You think that the package comes with lots of extra supplies WRONG it takes 4 different bottles of solution just to get a clorine reading and if you want to chk the PH the scale on test vile has colors so close together you cannot visibly distinguish them apart. It take 15 drops from 3 different numbered bottles that all look the same just to get a inaccurate and unreadable result. Cannot return chemicals to Amazon but they can send them to you. What a scam and out $60 went to Home Depot and bought kit that is useable for $14
customer_reviews.author: Joe Tittelfitz

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use test kit. Instructions are good and there are some very good YouTube videos as well. Was tired of taking my water weekly to local store and stand in line. Way better than test strips. Very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Nice test kit
customer_reviews.text: Very good at performing the pool tests as advertised. Wish it tested for salt though.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!
customer_reviews.text: My friend is a pool guy and said this is a great kit for long term use at home. I don’t know what anything does yet but I plan to learn. Cam packaged great, no damage. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: ddoug

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit is unreliable. the chlorine and pH readings I get are never close to the new automation equipment installed on the pool. The product is not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: PSU Alum

customer_reviews.title: Interpretation can be difficult
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but very complete. Some tests are difficult to interpret (i.e., when does the color change occur, when does the black dot disappear?) Difficult because the lighting and background has a significant effect on what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Longhorn

customer_reviews.title: Chemistry background helpful
customer_reviews.text: This kit is way to hard to use for the average person. The reagents are poorly marked for identifying. The YouTube videos were confusing. Vial was hard to read. Unless you use this kit often a simpler kit is advised. I studied chemistry in highschool and college.
customer_reviews.author: George Mann

customer_reviews.title: A must have for pool owners
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a must have for accurate results. I’ve been using test strips for 6 years and finally bought this one after realizing my CYA was so high. This takes A bite of time to use compared to test strips but you’ll be confident knowing you have accurate results. It’s a must have for pool owners.
customer_reviews.author: B Town

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is great but there are a few things in the instructions it tells you to use that did not come with the kit wish everything was in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Ward

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read Chlorine test
customer_reviews.text: All the tests work great for me except Chlorine. It’s really hard to read the level especially if it’s on the higher side.
customer_reviews.author: Britni S.

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive Pool Test Kit
customer_reviews.text: This is the kit you need to stay on top of your pool's water chemistry. Includes very thorough descriptions for the various chemical test and the importance of balance for each.
customer_reviews.author: MAK

customer_reviews.title: Complete water test kit
customer_reviews.text: Clear concise directions. This test kit will help insure I maintain the proper water chemistry in my pool. Test kit performs all the tests needed to maintain a pool.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W

customer_reviews.title: This Kit is too Technical to Use.
customer_reviews.text: Kit is too technical for simple layman use. This kit is for professional users. Would like to return it and obtain a simple kit for basic pool water testing.
customer_reviews.author: SW SWISHER

customer_reviews.title: Best pool test kit on the market. Period.
customer_reviews.text: If you hate going to the pool supply store for testing because you know they are going to try and sell you overpriced baking soda and bleach, you should get this kit. It does not test for phosphates.
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Deb

customer_reviews.title: Accurate complete kit
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were clear and kit is accurate we confirmed results against local pinch a penny
customer_reviews.author: tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Best kit I have used
customer_reviews.text: Great kit, fresh chemicals, lasts about 2 seasons of testing (Spring/Summer). I will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: UCrazyKid

customer_reviews.title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: I love having this to test my pool water. Some of it is way over my head but I’m learning
customer_reviews.author: Cathy F

customer_reviews.title: Best kit for spas
customer_reviews.text: The best product to use in order to maintain your spa water. Includes all the tests needed.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L

customer_reviews.title: As expected.
customer_reviews.text: Its a full blown test kit as expected. I would give it 5 stars if the manual was easier to navigate. Good to have because our pool store has been closed.
customer_reviews.author: terri huff

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: This kit is a must for pool owners who want to keep their pool balanced. I use this now and some days I use test strips. This is a kit that you can have confidence in. My pool water is in perfect shape now and is sparklingly clear. This is the easiest kit to read the color matches that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, reliable, very affordable and easy to use. Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Have used Taylor testing and test kits for years. They are good and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Harpo.

customer_reviews.title: I don't like this product
customer_reviews.text: Not that easy to read and use. The writing is small and confusing a to little .
customer_reviews.author: Flaskia Fennell

customer_reviews.title: He is extremely happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My Husband purchased this to replace the kit that he kept dropping, and the box would no longer close. He is extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Day

customer_reviews.title: ... quickly and it was exactly what we needed (also recommended to us by our pool builder)
customer_reviews.text: Received the kit very quickly and it was exactly what we needed (also recommended to us by our pool builder). The booklet included with the kit explains everything in excellent detail and tells you precisely what to do to fix it. This takes the guesswork out of owning your own pool - no hiring outside pool guys needed!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn D

customer_reviews.title: Results are off
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this for my hot tub but when I bring a water sample to the spa store the results are off. I’m not sure if the product is expired. I can’t find an expiration date on it. The PH is showing too high and the alkalinity is showing too low.
customer_reviews.author: Realcntrymusic

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned this is the only way to go to look after a hottub
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and money
customer_reviews.text: Great price and saves me trips to the pool store
customer_reviews.author: K Thibodeaux

customer_reviews.title: Pool water test kit.
customer_reviews.text: Performs a lot of pool water tests. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E. Hurlburt

customer_reviews.title: test it yourself
customer_reviews.text: though i dont enjoy feeling like i'm in a high school chemistry course again, this product is far more accurate than test strips, or taking samples to the pool store. nifty feature is the little 'wheel of fortune' that comes with the kit that allows you to evaluate what all the chemistry of the pool water actually means to your pool. if you follow it and the instructions precisely it allows you to get your pool water crystal clear. it is not simple to use however.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Rey

customer_reviews.title: WAY too much for basic pool maintenance not returnable  . Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: This is way too much and it very complicated for basic pool maintenance so don’t buy unless you want too much and not necessary items. Plus they send it and then u can’t return it as I purchased the the wrong item and it is useless to me now.
customer_reviews.author: Design Inc Jon Nickell

customer_reviews.title: False advertising!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely false advertising. The picture shows that you can test for salt levels but that was not an option when it arrived. When I called the company they said it is cheaper to print one instruction card fir all the kits in stead of one for each kit. I would never trust a company like this.
customer_reviews.author: Andy K

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased two of the Taylor test kits and suggest that you get the ease from keeping your pools in great shape.
customer_reviews.text: I have taken of the family pool from age 12. Now I am retired and asked to help a pool company stay caught up and ahead of the game; I have purchased two of the Taylor test kits and suggest that you get the ease from keeping your pools in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: ... a more accurate review The other tests worked really good
customer_reviews.text: Well I just got my testing kit - in the kit it’s says to use R-0002 but it’s not there - and -R-8071 is in there - after I tested my water there was no signs of chlorine at all - i tested with another kit and chorine was there so i’ll replace the chlorine test bottle right away and will give a more accurate review The other tests worked really good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its complicated
customer_reviews.text: its pretty complicated and uses a lot of reagents, i have to study it more. Be prepared to education yourself in water chemistry.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, clear instructions, nice info booklet on water quality care. Much easier to read vs test strips.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Like it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this kit because I wanted to measure total chlorine and free chlorine. I was overwhelmed when it arrived with all the bottles. But the instructions are simple, color coded and in the lid for easy access. The colors are easy to match when held to sunlight. I will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Teema

customer_reviews.title: Great testing kit.
customer_reviews.text: Great testing kit used by certified pool operators and pool owners who want accurate information.
customer_reviews.author: J. Storton

customer_reviews.title: Complete kit with instrux
customer_reviews.text: As a first time spa owner I needed a complete kit that was easy to use. This kit comes complete with a booklet that explains the chemistry and shows how to correct imbalances. Recommended by my former pool guy.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works great. Wish some of the instructions would have been clearer.
customer_reviews.author: Fladmier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect testing kit for our pool and hot tub water
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed. Came on time, packaged well, included everything as described in description!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Krepline

customer_reviews.title: Understanding pool chemistry!
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Taylor test kit for many years. I’m a CPO, (certified pool operator), now retired; but use the kit to maintain family and friend’s pools. I have tried others; but I am a big fan of the Taylor kits.
customer_reviews.author: Garland B.

customer_reviews.title: Great - but poor packaging!
customer_reviews.text: Product is great, just as specified and is complete. Works great. However, the "box" was just shipped in a plastic package with no "cushioning" to surround it. These are chemicals and seems like a very flimsy package to have shipped them in.
customer_reviews.author: SWFlorida

customer_reviews.title: kit was new and complete and arrived in one day ...
customer_reviews.text: kit was new and complete and arrived in one day! this is not the Fas-DPD test but shows free and total chlorine.
customer_reviews.author: Big jim

customer_reviews.title: is a good product, come with all regents needed .for pool water testing is been helping me alot.
customer_reviews.text: great product I will recommend this to anybody, and also the price it was right. thanks
customer_reviews.author: btimes

customer_reviews.title: Better than strips
customer_reviews.text: If you want accurate readings this is the way to go. Can not trust the strips
customer_reviews.author: dave65

customer_reviews.title: Complicated
customer_reviews.text: This kid is not for amateurs. It was completely over my head and I should’ve bought something more basic.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Bushman

customer_reviews.title: Taylor is the only test kit i will sell to my coustomers.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used taylor test kits for my entire pool service life of 40 plus years. it is the best and most reliable kit for the money and is user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: M Stu

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: You almost need to be a chemist to use this. I ended up buying a digital one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little box (not so little but very good size)
customer_reviews.text: Great little box (not so little but very good size). Has all we need to keep our pool in good shape (clean/clear)
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy  Van

customer_reviews.title: Defective Tests bottles
customer_reviews.text: After testing the free and combined chlorine, I opened the R-004 bottle to test pH. There was no small nipple on the bottle and the agent poured into the tube and over the deck. A little surprise. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: John Field MD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is my second kit. It is a no-hassle kit with excellent instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Furman

customer_reviews.title: Taylor test kits are awesome
customer_reviews.text: If you have a pool you must have the Taylor test kit. The results are very accurate and quick to perform. We use ours for a commercial pool where readings are required 4 times per day. If there was something out there that was easier to use than a Taylor test kit I would have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has all the chemicals needed to keep a pool properly balanced. Instruction book is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pool kit. I use it a few times per week on our saltwater pool

customer_reviews.title: The best way to calculate your water quality
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended, and its clear and easy to understand
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Professional Pool Testing
customer_reviews.text: My husband using this for his pool business and he is happy with product testing
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The instruction book is somewhat confusing for new customer. Will work through it.
customer_reviews.author: jmacp51

customer_reviews.title: Accurate reading 👌
customer_reviews.text: This tester works better than the strips And costs less than at pool store

customer_reviews.title: No refund or return should be clearly stated on order section. It is misleading.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t order this product from Amazon as no return or refund available. This is not clear on their product description,
customer_reviews.author: Ly  Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the pool
customer_reviews.text: Product made it in record time, this is the second time I have bought this particular Taylor kit and have been pleased with the results both times.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: More chemicals than most home owners would need, but they are there if you need them. Great quality and very convenient. Reagents need to be replaced every year because they loose their effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Holmberg

customer_reviews.title: You need this for your pool
customer_reviews.text: Why have I never ordered this for my pool before. Knowledge is king. Great product, shipping, service.

customer_reviews.title: That’s all you need for a pool!
customer_reviews.text: That’s all you need for a pool. Great product! Easy to use. My 11 years old can do by herself with our supervision.
customer_reviews.author: Zenmusic

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good test kit. If you have a pool, this is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Don Price

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but good to say about this test kit. Very easy to use once you've followed the directions and memorized them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wesley J Noland

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Had everything you need to test your pool water. Excellent price as well!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Alfaro

customer_reviews.title: Full Taylor pool test kit.
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived exactly as described by the seller. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good kit - very complete
customer_reviews.text: Has everything I need to keep my pool clear. in fact, it has more than I use but I really needed to be able to test for cyanuric acid since I have a salt-based chlorinator.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of th e best test kits around, Taylor products are very good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taddia

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by pool company
customer_reviews.text: I bought this test kit because the pool company service guys said that it was the best and the one they used. It is easy to use with the tests and chemicals all color coded. So far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to read than the strips. Easy to do tests
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal For Self-Maintenance
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy and we use it regularly. It helps us keep our pool water pristine and enjoyable. Definitely recommend for self-monitoring your pool chemical content.
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex

customer_reviews.title: Taylor K-2005 Complete Test Kit - High Range
customer_reviews.text: Very professional fee to this test kit. very happy with this purchase. other thoughts; I was new to pool testing prior to buying this kit. My cya level it around 50ppm and this test only tests for fc 0-5ppm so you have to dilute pool sample with equal part chlorine free water to show chlorine levels of 0-10ppm
customer_reviews.author: Elaine P

customer_reviews.title: Purchasing a product I could understand.
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use without having a degree in chemistry.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Well made and excellent instructions
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this test kit because it was recommended by friend. It has every test to ensure the water in your pool is maintained. I like the instructions because they are easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. and Mrs. V O

product_meta.title: Taylor K2005 Swimming Pool Chlorine Bromine Alkalinity Hardness pH DP Test Kit
product_meta.description: Taylor Technologies K-2005 Compete Test Kit, High Range. Maintaining safe pool/spa water for the public is an important responsibility. Therefore, precise test results are essential when checking the water quality of commercial pools and spas. Taylor's 2000 Series is designed for the kind of comprehensive, routine testing performed by service technicians, public and semipublic pool operators, and other professionals. Taylor's 2000 Series uses printed color standards to achieve a reliable and accurate color match, making frequent test comparisons even easier. 2000 Series kits feature six different standards for chlorine (High Range: 0.5-5 ppm, Low Range: 0.25-2.5 ppm), bromine (HR: 1-10 ppm, LR: .5-5 ppm) and pH (7.0 to 8.0). The Taylor Complete kit includes nine tests for thorough testing: Total Chlorine, Free Chlorine, Bromine, pH, Acid Demand, Base Demand, Total Alkalinity, Calcium Hardness, and Cyanuric Acid. Includes 3/4 ounce reagent bottles.
